nodes.bodyText: It never made any sense to make these configurable, just make these static variables.
post-match fireworks are barely used tho. Even pgm 1.9+ never used it except for arcade, ctw/dtc servers never used them
Simple: fireworks.enabled
Can be moved to the MatchModule
Don't we have some Locations or LocationUtil class?
@Electroid I was unable to find a Locations or LocationUtil class. Perhaps you have some guidance on this? I placed both of the FireworkUtil methods into the FireworkMatchModule for now.
Integrate this into a FireworksMatchModule implements MatchModule, Listener
There can just be 1 fireworks MatchModule, handle both event and post-match

fireworks:
     enabled: true
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -120,3 +120,16 @@ moderation:
     
   # Last message line shown on ban/temp-ban kick screen
   appeal-msg: ''
+  
+fireworks:
+  # Post-match fireworks fire above the winners of the current match
+  post-match:
+    enabled: true
+    number: 5
+    delay: 40 # ticks
+    frequency: 40 # ticks
+    iterations: 15
+    power: 2
+  # Goals spawn fireworks when objectives are completed
+  goals:
+    enabled: true

nodes.bodyText:
I would keep it as:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            fireworks:
          
          
            
              # Post-match fireworks fire above the winners of the current match
          
          
            
              post-match:
          
          
            
                enabled: true
          
          
            
                number: 5
          
          
            
                delay: 40 # ticks
          
          
            
                frequency: 40 # ticks
          
          
            
                iterations: 15
          
          
            
                power: 2
          
          
            
              # Goals spawn fireworks when objectives are completed
          
          
            
              goals:
          
          
            
                enabled: true
          
          
            
            fireworks:
          
          
            
              post-match: false
          
          
            
              goals: true
          
      
    
    
  

(post-match default being false)

nodes.bodyText: Don't use BukkitTask, instead Match#getScheduler(MatchScope.LOADED)
Seems like you do already, so no need to store the BukkitTask, it will get canceled automatically.
Should be static, and follow the static variable naming rules: ITERATION_COUNT
What are these magic numbers? They should probably be static variables too.
Also, why do we need static numbers? Can these variables not be derived by the size, location, etc.. of the objective?
Hmm, that's okay for now, we can skip over the magic numbers
Magic numbers.
We don't use @Nonnull, only @Nullable, so they can be removed here.
private static class
FIREWORK_TYPES
This doesn't seem like it belongs in this commit, should make another one to change this factory for the method reference to the constructor

Oh whoops, should have double checked 🤦‍♂.
Thanks for catching that @Pablete1234! I have an upcoming PR that will include that change.
Great suggestion @Pablete1234! I’ll take care of this as soon as I can, sorry for the delay.

TBH, if there are all just "magic" numbers, then let's skip the static variables.
Nice in theory, but there's way too many vars here.
I'd much rather have them as variables than magic numbers. If we ever feel like changing them it's much easier to have it this way
@applenick Go ahead and make that change, then ready to go
Post match default is false? Why not true?
It was suggested above by @Pablete1234 to have it default false. Personally I would have it as true. Want me to adjust it?
